awd_titl_txt: Microcomputer Laboratory Facility to Upgrade the Teaching ofUndergraduate Numerical Analysis and Related Courses
awd_abstract_narration: The Department of Mathematics and Computer Science at California                State University, Los Angeles will establish a microcomputer                    laboratory for advanced undergraduate courses.  The computation                 nature of the numerical analysis, numerical calculus, linear                    programming courses will be revised and applied linear algebra                  will be added to the curriculum.  Two thirds of the student body                are minorities.                                                                                                                                                 The laboratory will consist of 30 computers with access to all                  campus computers, video projector and printing stations.                                                                                                        The grantee is providing an equal sum obtained from non-Federal                 sources.
